name: (1Z)-1-[(2E,4E)-1,3-dimethyl-5-phenylpenta-2,4-dien-1-ylidene]-2-(2,4-dinitrophenyl)hydrazine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1314
Reason: The compound (1Z)-1-[(2E,4E)-1,3-dimethyl-5-phenylpenta-2,4-dien-1-ylidene]-2-(2,4-dinitrophenyl)hydrazine has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. The phenyl group and the penta-2,4-dienylidene group are both aromatic and planar, which can contribute to the melting point through π-π stacking interactions. The nitro functional group is electronegative and can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can also increase the melting point. However, the presence of multiple conjugated double bonds in the molecule can reduce the planarity and potential packing efficiency of the molecule, which may decrease the melting point. Starting with a base value for the hydrazine core around 100 degrees Celsius, the addition of the phenyl and penta-2,4-dienylidene groups might introduce an increase of approximately 20 degrees Celsius, due to their aromatic character and ability to participate in π-π stacking. The nitro functional group may introduce an additional 10 degrees Celsius increase due to its electronegativity and hydrogen bonding capabilities. Therefore, the estimated shift would be 100 (base) + 20 (aromatic contributions) + 10 (nitro functional group).
